bibl.title: Letter from William Alden Smith to Elihu Root, October 24, 1901

div1.p: Smith requests that Walter Reed be detailed to attend a medical conference at Ann Arbor, Michigan in order to present a paper about his research on yellow fever. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

RECEIVED
OCT 26 1901
OFFICE
Secretary of War.
My Dear Sir:-
div1.p:
The health officers of the state of
Michigan are to hold a conference at Ann Arbor November
21st and 22d and they are exceedingly anxious to have
Major Walter Reed, U.S.A/ present a paper at that conference
embodying his researches on yellow fever, and I write to
say that if you can give Major Reed a detail at that time
I shall greatly appreciate it as well as the health officers
of the state of Michigan.
